com.jaunt

Class Elements

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jaunt.Node
      • com.jaunt.Element
        • com.jaunt.Elements
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Element>

    public class Elements
extends Element
implements Iterable<Element>
    A container class for holding search results, which is itself searchable (inheriting search methods from Element). As an Element, it has the tagname #elements and only contains immediate children of type Element, each of which represents a single search result.
    Since:
    0.9.0
    Author:
    Tom Cervenka

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.jaunt.Node

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Elements()
      Creates an empty Elements object.
      Elements(List<Element> childElements)
      Creates a new Elements object who's immediate child elements are those in the specified list.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Iterator<Element> iterator()
      returns an iterator over the child Elements.
      int size()
      Returns the number of child Elements.
      List<Element> toList()
      Returns the child Elements as a List.
